user_prompt.scenario: You need to write a program that determines whether a given string is a palindrome. A string is considered a palindrome if it reads exactly the same forwards and backwards. Consider characters exactly as provided: comparisons are case-sensitive and spaces/punctuation are not ignored. Print 'true' if the input string is a palindrome and 'false' otherwise.
user_prompt.inputs: A single line string S read from standard input. S may contain letters, digits, spaces, and punctuation. Treat the string exactly as given (other than the trailing newline from input).
user_prompt.outputs: Print exactly one line containing either 'true' if S is a palindrome under exact matching, or 'false' otherwise.

generated_test_cases.description: M1: A clear, simple palindrome (odd length).
M3: A non-palindrome with mixed characters (even length).
E3: Palindrome with spaces and punctuation.
E4: Non-Palindrome failing due to asymmetrical punctuation.

redundant_cases: E6 (2-char palindrome - overlaps with E5 minimum length concept)
